article_title: Technical glitches plague computer-based standardized tests nationwide

article_metadata.description:
As most states have moved to new standardized tests based on the Common Core during the past two years, many also have switched from administering those tests the old-fashioned way — with paper and No. 2 pencils — to delivering them online using computers, laptops and tablets.
The transition aims to harness the power of technology to move beyond simplistic multiple-choice questions, using interactive questions to measure students' critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
But
article_metadata.author: Emma Brown, Washington Post News Service
